block.p: Amy Beth Corcoran was married last night to Charles Robert Spiegel III. The Rev. Dr. David M. Angelica, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony at the bridegroom's house in Brewster, Mass.

Ms. Corcoran, 35, is keeping her name. She is a vice president for trusts and estates at Sotheby's in New York. She graduated from Ithaca College. She is a daughter of Michael J. Corcoran of Bedford, N.H., and the late Mary Ann Mattei. Her father retired as the president of Astec, an environmental-hazard remediation company in Nashua, N.H. The bride's stepmother, Michele Doyle Corcoran, is the chief operating officer of Astec.
Amy Beth Corcoran was married last night to Charles Robert Spiegel III. The Rev. Dr. David M. Angelica, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony at the bridegroom's house in Brewster, Mass.

Ms. Corcoran, 35, is keeping her name. She is a vice president for trusts and estates at Sotheby's in New York. She graduated from Ithaca College. She is a daughter of Michael J. Corcoran of Bedford, N.H., and the late Mary Ann Mattei. Her father retired as the president of Astec, an environmental-hazard remediation company in Nashua, N.H. The bride's stepmother, Michele Doyle Corcoran, is the chief operating officer of Astec.

Mr. Spiegel, 44, is an architect in Brewster. He is a son of Joan Spiegel and Charles Robert Spiegel Jr. of St. James City, Fla. His father retired as an electrician in Branford, Conn. His mother retired as the principal of the Pine Orchard School in Branford. The bridegroom's previous marriage ended in divorce.
